underline: PAUL CRESTON 603 E. Tacom Ellensburg, Washington 98926
p: On my way to Washington State from New York ( to teach at Central Washington State College) I stopped in Kearney, Nebraska. In a gift store I saw your recent book of poems and glanced thru it to see if the two poems I had set to music many years ago were in-cluded. They were - so I purchased the book and asked the clerk if she knew your present address. She said she would find out and write to me about it.
The two poems which I set to music are LULLABY and FOUNTAIN SONG. They were composed in 1950 and immediately published. They sold very well. I thought you might like to know this.
If I send you my copy of the book would you be so kind as to inscribe it to me? I should appreciate it very much.
